description.plain:
Céline Marie Claudette Dion is a Canadian singer. She is renowned for her powerful, technically skilled vocals, and remains the best-selling Canadian recording artist and one of the best-selling artists of all time with record sales of over 250 million worldwide.
She emerged as a teen star in her home country with a series of French-language albums during the 1980s. She first gained international recognition by winning both the 1982 Yamaha World Popular Song Festival and the 1988 Eurovision Song Contest, where she represented Switzerland. After learning to speak English, she signed on to Epic Records in the United States. In 1990, Dion released her debut English-language album, Unison, establishing herself as a viable pop artist in North America and other English-speaking areas of the world.

songs.full_title: My Heart Will Go On by Céline Dion
songs.title: My Heart Will Go On

description.plain:
The main theme song to James Cameron’s blockbuster film Titanic. James Horner first wrote the musical backing  as part of the score, taking inspiration from Jethro Tull. Then he decided to add lyrics, courtesy of Will Jennings. After Celine Dion was convinced to record (not her first time doing a movie theme), Horner had to find a day where the notoriously ill-tempered Cameron would be welcoming to show him.

“My Heart Will Go On” then was turned into the end credits theme, and its association with the eventual highest-grossing movie ever (until Cameron topped his own record 11 years later) led to the song topping charts everywhere, as well as an Oscar and two Grammys… and overexposure to the point Titanic star Kate Winslet admits she feels like throwing up when hearing it.

FUN FACT: Celine did not want to record this song, check out her recent interview Andy Cohen. She elaborates on the song process as well.

https://youtu.be/conBmLdtUEw?t=1m24s

songs.title: How Does a Moment Last Forever
songs.title_with_featured: How Does a Moment Last Forever

description.plain:
“How Does A Moment Last Forever” is an original song written by Alan Menken and Tim Rice for the 2017 live-action adaptation of Disney’s Beauty and the Beast.

Within the film, a segment of the song is sung by Belle’s father (Kevin Kline) as he completes a music box. This single version of the song, performed by Céline Dion, appears during the film’s ending credits.

Celine performed the song for the first time at her residency show at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace, Las Vegas on May 24, 2017. Dion sported a beautiful yellow dress reminiscent of Belle’s ball gown in the movie.

Dion previously appeared on the soundtrack of the original 1991 animated film, singing the single version of “Beauty and the Beast” alongside Peabo Bryson.

songs.lyrics:
How does a moment last forever?
How can a story never die?
It is love we must hold onto
Never easy, but we try
Sometimes our happiness is captured
Somehow, our time and place stand still
Love lives on inside our hearts and always will

Minutes turn to hours, days to years then gone
But when all else has been forgotten
Still our song lives on

Maybe some moments weren’t so perfect
Maybe some memories not so sweet
But we have to know some bad times
Or our lives are incomplete
Then when the shadows overtake us
Just when we feel all hope is gone
We’ll hear our song and know once more
Our love lives on

How does a moment last forever?
How does our happiness endure?
Through the darkest of our troubles
Love is beauty, love is pure
Love pays no mind to desolation
It flows like a river through the soul
Protects, proceeds, and perseveres
And makes us whole

Minutes turn to hours, days to years then gone
But when all else has been forgotten
Still our song lives on

How does a moment last forever
When our song lives on

songs.full_title: Ashes by Céline Dion
songs.title: Ashes

description.plain:
“Ashes” is an emotional ballad about the rise and rise of superhuman agent of death and vengeance Wade Wilson aka Deadpool.

Iconic singer Celine Dion affirms her position in pop culture as the premier voice of pure emotion as she soundtracks Deadpool’s mastery of contemporary ballet.




[SPOILER ALERT]

The song was released a week after the release of Marvel Studio’s Avengers: Infinity War, in which Marvel’s roster of superheroes were turned to ash by the power of Thanos wielding the Infinity Gauntlet. Thanos was played by Josh Brolin, who also plays Cable in Deadpool 2. Meta-references to the wider Marvel Cinematic Universe also appeared in the teaser trailer for DP2.

songs.full_title: Because You Loved Me by Céline Dion
songs.title: Because You Loved Me

description.plain:
“Because You Loved Me” is a song recorded by Canadian singer Celine Dion for her fourth English-language studio album, Falling into You. The song was released as the first single from the album. Lyrically, the song finds the protagonist thanking a loved one for being there for her, as well as making her the person she is today.

The song was nominated for “Record of the Year”, “Best Female Pop Vocal Performance”, “Song of the Year”, and won the 1997 Grammy Award for “Best Song Written Specifically for a Motion Picture or Television”.

songs.full_title: That's the Way It Is by Céline Dion
songs.title: That’s the Way It Is

description.plain: The 10th track and lead single of Celine Dion’s 1999 greatest hits album All the Way…A Decade of Song. Featuring an upbeat vibe not often seen from Dion, who is best known for ballads such as My Heart Will Go On, “That’s The Way It Is” is one of her more successful singles, topping both the US and Canada Adult Contemporary charts as well as reaching the top ten in various charts around the world.

songs.full_title: Recovering by Céline Dion
songs.title: Recovering

description.plain:
Following the early 2016 deaths of Celine Dion’s longtime husband and manager, René Angélil and her brother Daniel to cancer, Pink wrote “Recovering” for Dion as “a tool, a piece of luggage to help me walk, to help me move forward.”

Though “Recovering” was teased in the summer of 2016, while Dion was also promoting the return of her Las Vegas residency and new French album Encore un soir, it was not released until September 9, when she also performed the song during the televised special Stand Up 2 Cancer.

songs.title: Think Twice

description.plain:
“Think Twice” was released as the fourth single from Céline’s third English-language studio album, The Colour of My Love (1993).

The song went to number 1 all over Europe, including: Ireland (9 weeks at the top), United Kingdom (7 weeks), Belgium Flanders (5 weeks), Netherlands (4 weeks), Norway (4 weeks) and Sweden (4 weeks). It was also successful in Australia reaching number 2.

songs.full_title: Encore un soir by Céline Dion
songs.title: Encore un soir

description.plain:
“Encore un soir” est le premier single par Celine Dion depuis la mort de son mari et son directeur de plusieurs années, René Angélil, qui est mort en janvier 2016 à cause de cancer.  La chanson, écrite par collaborateur fréquent (et un des quatre hommes de l'album 1 fille 4 types) Jean Jacques Goldman, contient des paroles qui expriment sa tristesse après sa mort, mais qui est délicate aussi; Dion a raconté qu'elle a demandé à Goldman d'écrire une autre chanson comme celles qu'il l'a écrite qu'il y a quelques années:

Quand j'ai appelé Jean-Jacques Goldman, il m'a dit: “J'ai tout écrit sur toi, tout donné, je ne peux pas faire mieux.” De passage à Boston, je l'ai rappelé pour lui dire qu'il y avait un thème qu'il n'avait jamais abordé: le pont entre deux rives, entre deux vies. Et, avec sa délicatesse habituelle, Jean-Jacques m'a écrit une chanson qui n'est même pas triste.

songs.title: I’m Your Angel

description.plain:
“I’m Your Angel” marks the first collaboration between How Does a Moment Last Forever and R. Kelly and appeared on both of their studio albums: Kelly’s R and Celine’s These Are Special Times.

The track was very successful, peaking at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 for 6 weeks and it was certified platinum by the RIAA, just two months after its release.

In January of 2019, the song was removed from  digital marketplaces and streaming platforms due to recent sexual misconduct allegations towards R. Kelly.

songs.full_title: The Show Must Go On by Céline Dion (Ft. Lindsey Stirling)
songs.title: The Show Must Go On
songs.title_with_featured: The Show Must Go On (Ft. Lindsey Stirling)

description.plain:
Though Celine Dion has been covering Queen’s “The Show Must Go On” as part of the setlist of her Las Vegas show since at least 2008, the song took on new meaning after the winter 2016 death of her longtime husband and manager, René Angélil. Dion noted the song’s significance to their relationship in an interview with People ahead of her performance of the song at the 2016 Billboard Music Awards:

René always insisted the show must go on … You know what, I’m 48 years old and I lost the love of my life. I miss him a lot from when he was great but not when he was suffering. I cannot be selfish. You have to let people go. I feel at peace.

Celine performed the song at the 2016 Billboard Music Awards accompanied by Lindsey Stirling. She received the Icon Award after her performance.

songs.full_title: I Drove All Night by Céline Dion
songs.title: I Drove All Night

description.plain:
“I Drove All Night” was released as the lead single from Dion’s One Heart in 2003. The release was critically well received and debuted in the Canadian Hot 100 at the #1 spot where it stayed for 5 straight weeks. It peaked at #45 on the Billboard Hot 100 and sales of the single caused it to reach #26 on the Hot 100 Singles Sales chart. Dance remixes even led it to reach #2 on the Hot Dance Club Play chart.

The song was written for and recorded by Roy Orbison in 1987, but wasn’t released at that time. The song was made famous by Cyndi Lauper in her 1989 version. After that, Roy’s version was released initially as part of a compilation in 1991 and as a single and in his posthumous album in 1992.

songs.full_title: Call the Man by Céline Dion
songs.title: Call the Man

description.plain:
“Call the Man” is a song by Canadian singer Celine Dion, recorded for her fourth English-language album, Falling into You (1996).
It was released as the fifth and last single outside of North America on 16 June 1997.
“Call the Man” was written by Andy Hill and Peter Sinfield, who already wrote for Dion her 1995 smash hit “Think Twice,” and produced by Jim Steinman who also worked on her previous single “It’s All Coming Back to Me Now”.

songs.full_title: Taking Chances by Céline Dion
songs.title: Taking Chances

description.plain:
The lead single from the album of the same name, Taking Chances was penned by songwriter Kara DioGuardi and former Eurythmics member Dave Stewart. It was originally intended for the duo’s collaboration outfit, Platinum Weird. After playing it for Dion’s husband René Angélil, who loved it and urged Dion to record it, it was released in the fall of 2007.



After being released by Dion, the single opened to critical acclaim and worldwide chart success, peaking in the top ten of Canada, France, Denmark, Belgium, Switzerland, and Italy. The track also topped the Billboard US Hot Dance Club Songs chart, becoming her  second song to do so, following 1994’s “Misled”.

description.plain: Céline Dion dedicated this haunting and emotional song to her niece Karen, who died of cystic fibrosis.  This indeed was one of the most emotional songs Dion has ever performed. The song was also written by her good Jean Goldman who shocked Dion by the way he put how she felt into a song.

songs.full_title: My Love by Céline Dion
songs.title: My Love

description.plain: Written and produced by Linda Perry and originally featured on Cèline’s ninth English studio album Taking Chances which released in 2007. The song was recorded as a live version in Stockholm, Sweden in 2008 during Cèline’s Taking Chances World Tour. Cèline has a very emotional bond with the song and rarely sings it live because of the sentimentality she feels towards it. She once said while thinking of the song that she had a hard time finding words for why it moves her so much but she would say it is probably because it goes out to – and therefore reminds her of – her very supportive fan base.

description.plain: “One Heart” is a song recorded by Céline Dion, for her eight English studio album One Heart. The song was written and produced by John Shanks and Kara DioGuardi. It was released June 16th, 2003 as the second single from the album.

songs.full_title: The Magic Of Christmas Day (God Bless Us Everyone) by Céline Dion
songs.title: The Magic Of Christmas Day (God Bless Us Everyone)
songs.title_with_featured: The Magic Of Christmas Day (God Bless Us Everyone)

description.plain:
“The Magic Of Christmas Day” was written in 1995 by Twisted Sister frontman Dee Snider as a gift for his wife. The engineer who recorded Snider’s version was producing Dion’s 1998 holiday album These Are Special Times and informed Snider that Dion wanted to record his track, and was not yet aware he was the writer.

In 1999, Dion re-recorded “The Magic Of Christmas Day” with Rosie O'Donnell for her holiday compilation A Rosie Christmas. Some proceeds from sales of the album benefitted The For All Kids Foundation.

songs.full_title: Nothing Broken But My Heart by Céline Dion
songs.title: Nothing Broken But My Heart

description.plain:
“Nothing Broken But My Heart” was the second Céline Dion’s single written by Diane Warren. It was produced by Walter Afanasieff.

The music video was made for the edited version, because the original track lasts almost six minutes. This video was released in August 1992 and features actors practicing the Romeo and Juliet play. It was directed by Lyne Charlebois.

“Nothing Broken But My Heart” was the second Dion’s single which reached number 1 position on the U.S. Hot Adult Contemporary Tracks (this time for one week). The song peaked at number 3 in Canada and number 29 in the United States (number 35 on the Billboard Hot 100 Airplay and number 49 on the Hot 100 Singles Sales). According to Nielsen SoundScan, the single has sold 145,000 copies in the U.S.

songs.full_title: Misled by Céline Dion
songs.title: Misled

description.plain:
“Misled” is the third single from Céline’s album The Colour of My Love. It was released in March 1994. It topped the Hot Dance Club Play chart in the United States for 2 weeks. It was her first number 1 on that chart. The song won the BMI Pop Award for Most Performed Song in the United States.

The music video was directed by Randee St. Nicholas. It alternates between scenes of Céline  performing in a club, posing in front of a mirror and in a bathtub, and quarreling with a lover.

Un coup d'œil à son dos, ses hanches
Quand s'efface le galantin
Un regard quand elle se penche
Et laisse deviner un sein
Elle sait déjà ses mains, les contours de sa bouche
Le cambré de ses reins qu'elle a noté en douce
Car le ballet
Va s'animer
Il a su les codes et donner les bons mots de passe
Encore un peu d'alcool et que tombent les cuirasses
Livrées les clés des corps, enfin les peaux s'embrassent
Et le temps s'arrête tant que dure la grâce
Car le ballet
Est bientôt
Terminé
Et la vraie vie
A commencé
Eh oui
La vraie vie

songs.lyrics:
So suddenly, so strange
Life wakes you up, things change
I've done my best, I've served my call
I thought I had it all
So suddenly, so strong
My prejudice was gone
You needed me, I found my place
I'm there for now, these days

Now the greatest reward
Is the light in your eyes
The sound of your voice
And the touch of your hand
You made me who I am

You trusted me to grow
I gave my heart to show
There's nothing else I cherish more
I stand by you for sure

Now the greatest reward
Is the love that I can give
I'm here for you now
For as long as I live
You made me who I am

So suddenly, it's clear to me
Things change
Our future lies in here and now
We live it through somehow

Now the greatest reward
Is the love that I can give
I'm here for you now
For as long as I live
